'''Chimecho''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''チリーン''' ''Chirean'') is a {{type|Psychic}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolve]]s from {{p|Chingling}} when [[level]]ed up with high [[friendship]] during the [[Time|night]].

==Biology==
Chimecho is a small, round Pokémon with a mainly bluish white body shaped like a fūrin {{wp|wind chime}}. It has beady, yellow eyes and three stubby limbs. Its body has a horizontal {{wp|Amaranth (color)|amaranth}}-colored pattern. Underneath its body extends a long, tag-like tail that has amaranth patterning at the bottom. A yellow, globular growth, referred to as a ''suction cup'' or a ''sucker'', is connected to the top of its body.

Chimecho can create ultrasonic sound waves and other noises. It uses seven different echoing cries to communicate with others. It is nocturnal and usually lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grasslands}} and woods, but some are found in mountainous regions. It eats Berries that it plucks with its tail.

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Furisode Girl Chimecho.png|250px|left|thumb|Chimecho in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[James's Chimecho]]=====
[[James]] has a {{TP|James|Chimecho}} that was obtained in ''[[AG084|Who's Flying Now?]]'' at the [[Fortree City]] Feather Carnival. It said its name in the {{TRT}} motto right after [[Jessie's Wobbuffet]], and James cherished it so much that he did not allow it to battle. In ''[[AG147|Sweet Baby James]]'', James left his Chimecho with his [[Nanny and Pop-Pop]] to recover from illness at his old vacation home in [[Saffron City]].

=====Other=====
A Chimecho appeared in the ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]'' and ''[[SS021|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky - Beyond Time & Darkness]]'' in the [[Wigglytuff's Guild]]. She prepared the meals for the guild, allowed the player to add Pokémon to his or her team, and also allowed the player to arrange the team and choose different Team Leaders.

A Chimecho appeared in ''[[DP154|Mastering Current Events!]]'', under the ownership of {{OBP|Maya|DP154}}. Maya's Chimecho used winds to fly and was used against [[McCann|her grandfather]] in battle, but it was defeated by {{p|Scizor}}.

====Minor appearances====
A Chimecho made a brief appearance in ''[[M10|The Rise of Darkrai]]''.

A Chimecho appeared in ''[[DP161|Yes in Dee Dee, It's Dawn!]]'', under the ownership of a {{pkmn|Coordinator}}. It was used along with a {{p|Chingling}} for the [[Double Performance]] required during the {{to|Daybreak}} {{pkmn|Contest}}.

A Chimecho appeared in ''[[XY073|A Fashionable Battle!]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Furisode Girl}}.

A Chimecho appeared in ''[[XY092|Cloudy Fate, Bright Future!]]'', under the ownership of a {{tc|Psychic}}.

[[File:Old couple Chimecho Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Chimecho in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Ash & Pikachu manga===
{{main|James's Chimecho}}
[[James]] owns a {{TP|James|Chimecho}} in the [[Ash & Pikachu]] manga.

===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Chimecho first appeared in ''[[PS180|The Last Battle XIV]]'', as a wild Pokémon pictured in one of the many photographs of unseen Pokémon that {{adv|Professor Oak}} discovered.

The old couple of [[Mt. Pyre]] each own a Chimecho. They first appeared in ''[[PS229|You Can Fight Day or Night With Lunatone & Solrock]]''.

A Trainer's Chimecho appeared in ''[[PS418|Deprogramming Porygon-Z]]''.

===In the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blazing Exploration Team manga===
Chimecho appeared in the Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Blazing Exploration Team manga as a [[List of Wigglytuff's Guild members|member]] of [[Wigglytuff's Guild]].

==Trivia==
* Chimecho's {{DL|List of Pokémon by index number (GBA)|index number}} is the very last in the [[Generation III]] games (excluding glitch Pokémon, and {{p|Unown}} forms), except in {{g|XD: Gale of Darkness}}, in which this trait belongs to {{p|Munchlax}}.
* Chimecho's [[National Pokédex]] number and the number of the episode in which it first appeared are the same: 358.

===Origin===
Chimecho is based on a Japanese fūrin {{wp|wind chime}}.

====Name origin====
Chimecho is a combination of ''chime'' and ''echo''.

Chirean is a combination of ちりんちりん ''chirinchirin'' (onomatopoeia for bell chiming) and 風鈴 ''fūrin'' (wind chime).
